The **wand of fear** is a wand in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). Zapping it at a target causes the target to become [scared](/wiki/Scare "Scare") and [flee](/wiki/Flee "Flee") ("\<foo> suddenly panics!")[\[2\]](#cite_note-2). Monsters with sufficient [MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") may resist being scared, and [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") targets will not be affected.

The wand has a base value of 200, equal to that of the wands of [cancellation](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation"), [create monster](/wiki/Wand_of_create_monster "Wand of create monster"), [polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph"), and [teleportation](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation").

Attempting to [engrave](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave") with a wand of fear returns the message "The bugs on the \<floor> run away!" The wand will not self-identify, though this is the only wand that will have this effect.

## Strategy

The wand of fear gives combat pragmatists a new option for scaring away monsters they do not want to fight. Its advantages are that it does not depend on vulnerable environmental factors (like [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") or a dropped [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster")), does not require spellcasting [energy](/wiki/Energy "Energy") (as casting [cause fear](/wiki/Spellbook_of_cause_fear "Spellbook of cause fear") or [turn undead](/wiki/Spellbook_of_turn_undead "Spellbook of turn undead") would), and does not awaken sleeping monsters (as a [tooled horn](/wiki/Tooled_horn "Tooled horn") or [leather drum](/wiki/Leather_drum "Leather drum") would). Its disadvantages are that it is limited by its number of [charges](/wiki/Charge "Charge"), only affects monsters that are zapped with it, can be resisted, and has no effect on the undead.

In spite of these disadvantage, a wand of fear can be a useful [escape item](/wiki/Escape_item "Escape item") in certain situations, as when there is a single enemy you want to scare away, one that has a low magic resistance and is not undead.

As with other methods of scaring monsters, players should remember that fleeing monsters can still use ranged attacks, and that attacking a fleeing opponent is a [cowardly](/wiki/Knight#Honor_in_combat "Knight") act for [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight").

## Hack'EM

The wand of fear also appears in [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") with some changes from SLASH'EM. It is now an omnidirectional wand that behaves the same as the cause fear spell. [Breaking](/wiki/Breaking_wands "Breaking wands") it causes you to panic in fear and also scares surrounding enemies.

Zapping a cursed wand of fear will instead inflict you with fear 80% of the time. If monsters are fleeing, they stop. If monsters are paralyzed or sleeping, they wake up and are able to move.

[Intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent "Intelligent") monsters are also able to zap this wand as a defensive action.

## References
